intro: Begonia serratipetala, commonly known as the serrated petal begonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, serrated-edged leaves and showy, fleshy flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for shaded garden beds. Its unique foliage and vibrant blooms make it a valuable addition to both ornamental and botanical collections.
